summary: This document is a chain of emails from October 2020 among law enforcement and prosecutors coordinating the scheduling of an interview and the review of a draft affidavit for an amended search warrant related to drives seized from Jeffrey Epstein's New York residence. It reveals ongoing investigative activity years after Epstein's death.

persons.name: Detective
persons.role: NYPD / FBI Child Exploitation Human Trafficking Task Force Detective
persons.context: A detective from the joint NYPD/FBI task force is involved in scheduling interviews and is copied on emails regarding the search warrant application.

persons.name: Assistant United States Attorney
persons.role: Assistant United States Attorney, Southern District of New York
persons.context: The AUSA drafted an affidavit for an amended search warrant for drives from Epstein's NY residence and is coordinating its review and execution with law enforcement.

connections.description: They are working together on the investigation, with the AUSA preparing legal documents and the detective involved in scheduling and task force operations.

events.title: Draft Affidavit for Amended Warrant Circulated
events.description: An Assistant United States Attorney circulates a draft affidavit in support of an amended search warrant for three drives seized from Jeffrey Epstein's New York residence.

events.title: Scheduling Coordination for Warrant and Interview
events.description: Law enforcement and prosecutors exchange emails to schedule a time to swear out the amended warrant affidavit and to reschedule an interview with an individual (likely a witness or person of interest).

keyFacts: Investigative activity related to the Epstein case was ongoing as of October 2020, after Epstein's death in 2019.
Law enforcement sought an amended search warrant for three digital drives seized from Epstein's New York residence.
An interview with an individual (name redacted) was canceled and being rescheduled, indicating continued witness or subject cooperation.
The coordination involves a joint NYPD/FBI Child Exploitation Human Trafficking Task Force and the U.S. Attorney's Office for the Southern District of New York.
